009package imagingbook.common.geometry.hulls;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.isZero;
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.radius;
013import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
014import static imagingbook.common.math.Matrix.add;
015import static imagingbook.common.math.Matrix.multiply;
016import static java.lang.Math.sqrt;
017
018import java.awt.Shape;
019import java.awt.geom.Path2D;
020
021import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
022import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntDouble;
023import imagingbook.common.geometry.line.AlgebraicLine;
024import imagingbook.common.geometry.shape.ShapeProducer;
025import imagingbook.common.util.ArrayIterator;
026
027/**
028 * Represents a major axis-aligned bounding box of a 2D point set.
029 * 
030 * @author WB
031 * @version 2022/06/23
032 * 
033 */
034public class AxisAlignedBoundingBox implements ShapeProducer {
035        
036        private final Iterable<Pnt2d> points;
037        private final PntDouble centroid;
038        private final double[] orientationVector;
039        private final Pnt2d[] boundingbox;
040        private final AlgebraicLine[] boundinglines;
041
042        
043        public AxisAlignedBoundingBox(Iterable<Pnt2d> points) {
044                this.points = points;
045                this.centroid = makeCentroid();
046                this.orientationVector = makeOrientationVector();
047                this.boundingbox = makeBox();
048                this.boundinglines = new AlgebraicLine[] {
049                        AlgebraicLine.from(boundingbox[0], boundingbox[1]),
050                        AlgebraicLine.from(boundingbox[1], boundingbox[2]),
051                        AlgebraicLine.from(boundingbox[2], boundingbox[3]),
052                        AlgebraicLine.from(boundingbox[3], boundingbox[0])};
053        }
054        
055        public AxisAlignedBoundingBox(Pnt2d[] points) {
056//              this(() -> Arrays.stream(points).iterator());   // https://stackoverflow.com/questions/10335662/convert-java-array-to-iterable
057                this(() -> ArrayIterator.from(points));
058        }
059        
060        public Pnt2d getCentroid() {
061                return centroid;
062        }
063        
064        public double[] getOrientationVector() {
065                return orientationVector;
066        }
067        
068        /**
069         * Returns an array holding the 4 corner points of the bounding box or 
070         * {@code null} if the orientation of the point set is undefined.
071         * @return as described above
072         */
073        public Pnt2d[] getCornerPoints() {
074                return (boundingbox == null) ? null : boundingbox;
075        }
076                
077        /**
078         * Calculates the major axis-aligned bounding box of 
079         * the supplied region, as a sequence of four point
080         * coordinates (p0, p1, p2, p3).
081         * 
082         * @param points binary region
083         * @return the region's bounding box as a sequence of 4 coordinates (p0, p1, p2, p3)
084         */
085        private Pnt2d[] makeBox() {
086                //double theta = getOrientationAngle(points);
087                
088                double[] xy = this.orientationVector;
089                if (xy == null) {       // regin's orientation is undefined
090                        return null;
091                }
092                        
093                double xa = xy[0]; // = Math.cos(theta);
094                double ya = xy[1]; // = Math.sin(theta);
095                double[] ea = {xa,  ya};
096                double[] eb = {ya, -xa};
097                
098                double amin = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
099                double amax = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
100                double bmin = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
101                double bmax = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
102                
103                for (Pnt2d p : points) {
104                        double u = p.getX();
105                        double v = p.getY();
106                        double a = u * xa + v * ya;     // project (u,v) on the major axis vector
107                        double b = u * ya - v * xa;     // project (u,v) on perpendicular vector
108                        amin = Math.min(a, amin);
109                        amax = Math.max(a, amax);
110                        bmin = Math.min(b, bmin);
111                        bmax = Math.max(b, bmax);
112                }
113                
114//              double delta = 1e-6;
115//              amin -= delta;
116//              bmin -= delta;
117//              amax += delta;
118//              bmax += delta;
119                
120                Pnt2d[] corners = new Pnt2d[4];
121                corners[0] = PntDouble.from(add(multiply(amin, ea), multiply(bmin, eb)));
122                corners[1] = PntDouble.from(add(multiply(amin, ea), multiply(bmax, eb)));
123                corners[2] = PntDouble.from(add(multiply(amax, ea), multiply(bmax, eb)));
124                corners[3] = PntDouble.from(add(multiply(amax, ea), multiply(bmin, eb)));
125                return corners;
126        }
127
128        public double[] makeOrientationVector() {
129                double mu20 = 0;
130                double mu02 = 0;
131                double mu11 = 0;
132
133                for (Pnt2d p : points) {
134                        double dx = (p.getX() - centroid.x);
135                        double dy = (p.getY() - centroid.y);
136                        mu20 = mu20 + dx * dx;
137                        mu02 = mu02 + dy * dy;
138                        mu11 = mu11 + dx * dy;
139                }
140                
141                double A = 2 * mu11;
142                double B = mu20 - mu02;
143                
144                double xTheta = B + sqrt(sqr(A) + sqr(B));
145                double yTheta = A;
146                double d = radius(xTheta, yTheta);
147                
148                return (isZero(d)) ? null : new double[] {xTheta / d, yTheta / d};
149        }
150        
151        private PntDouble makeCentroid() {
152                int n = 0;
153                double su = 0;
154                double sv = 0;
155                for (Pnt2d p : points) {
156                        su += p.getX();
157                        sv += p.getY();
158                        n++;
159                }
160                if (n == 0) {
161                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("empty point sequence!");
162                }
163                return PntDouble.from(su/n, sv/n);
164        }
165
166
167        // shape-related methods:
168        
169        @Override
170        public Path2D getShape(double scale) {
171                // shape of the actual bounding box
172                Path2D p = new Path2D.Double(Path2D.WIND_NON_ZERO, 4);
173                p.moveTo(boundingbox[0].getX(), boundingbox[0].getY());
174                p.lineTo(boundingbox[1].getX(), boundingbox[1].getY());
175                p.lineTo(boundingbox[2].getX(), boundingbox[2].getY());
176                p.lineTo(boundingbox[3].getX(), boundingbox[3].getY());
177                p.closePath();
178                return p;
179        }
180        
181        @Override
182        public Shape[] getShapes(double scale) {
183                return new Shape[] { 
184                                getShape(scale),                                // primary shape element
185                                getCentroid().getShape(scale)   // additional shape elements
186                                };
187        }
188        
189        public static final double DefaultContainsTolerance = 1e-12;
190        
191        public boolean contains(Pnt2d p) {
192                return contains(p, DefaultContainsTolerance);
193        }
194        
195        /**
196         * Checks if this bounding box contains the specified point.
197         * This method is used instead of {@link Path2D#contains(double, double)}
198         * to avoid false results due to roundoff errors.
199         * 
200         * @param p some 2D point
201         * @param tolerance positive quantity for being outside
202         * @return true if the point is inside the bounding box
203         */
204        public boolean contains(Pnt2d p, double tolerance) {
205                for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
206                        double dist = boundinglines[0].getSignedDistance(p);
207                        // positive signed distance means that the point is to the left
208                        if (dist + tolerance < 0) {
209                                return false;
210                        }
211                }
212                return true;
213        }
214}
